TopicTitle: 100 ways to get kicked out of wallmart

Articles.Content: 189. Wear full combat-gear, a green beret and a TRG-42. Walk across the store to the managers office and ask him how to get up on the roof of the building, and in case itÃ‚Â´s locked you should remember to ask for the keyes. Without any violent means of course! Be professional for once! ;P
Run around screaming: THE END OF KERBOL IS NEAR!!!!!!!!!!
190: Taking Jeb with you.

191: Playing laser tag with 99 other people in the store.

Edited June 15, 2013 by The Destroyer
Wrong number by a lot.
192(yes thats right 192).Go ,and drop every gallon of milk.
193: Randomly pepper spray people

No. Well...maybe in California. But they're mostly idiots there anyway.

I take offence! And no tank through building doesn't happen here.
194.Have a world war food fight in the food section.
195. Punch an employee
196. say we are gonna crash with Kerbin and kerbals will appear randomly
197.Say that Walmart is some sort of secret police that will kill anyone who speaks bad about walmart.
198. Say that if you dont get out now you will die!
199.go fill a cart up with a bunch of merchandise ,and push it down path ,and say you slipped.
200. Finish this thread

201 -

Pretend like it's Costco. Try to buy everything by the case.

202: Ask if they give AAA discounts on Great Value-brand Uranium

AAA is a car club that provides roadside service if you're a member. They make deals with different corporations so that their members can get a discount.

203

Ask if they give out Airmiles. Make a fuss when they say no. "I got some last time!!" etc.
204: Ask why that you aren't Jesus and that you should be,
205.Ask if they sell petrol ,and if they don't say that you will donate.
206. Ask for a price check on an item.
207. Do the Harlem Shake on an employee's head, with 20 other people.

208 -

Start taking all comers in a no holds barred cage match.
209: Reenact a famous WWII battle with live ammunition and artillery.

210

Set all the televisions to Keeping up With the Kardashians. (I'm sorry, that's just cruel...)
